title: What Is Driving U.S. Inflation amid a Global Inflation Surge?
description: In June 2022, the 12-month inflation rate of the U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) hit 9.1%, its highest level in over 40 years. The U.S. is not alone: Across the industrialized world, inflation is accelerating during the recovery from the pandemic recession. Although inflation is surging globally, the sources of inflation are different in each country.
dc:creator: Royal, James; Zhang, Jing; Miles, Russell; Hobijn, Bart
